prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
In order to maximize the continuum sensitivity, we emply the TDM mode, giving an effective instantaneous frequency coverage of 7.5 GHz.
The spectral resolution of TDM is 31.2 MHz or ~35 km/s at 1.1mm, which is sufficient for any serendipitous [CII] and CO line detections from high-z galaxies. Considering typical velocity widths of high-z galaxies, i.e., 100 km/s - 500 km/s (FWHM), a velocity resolution of ~35 km/s is appropriate.

All targets are high redshift sources and the sizes are naturally expected to be small, i.e., less than a few arcsec. On the other hand, in order to avoid loosing sensitivity for slightly extended galaxies (i.e., relatively low-z galaxies with an extended disk), we prefer a moderate angular resolution, i.e., 0.8 arcsec.
Note that 1.0 arcsec to 0.5 arcsec resolutions can be acceptable for our science cases, although too much high resolution (less than 0.4 arcsec, for instance) may result in loosing a sensitivity for extended galaxies.

The primary goal of this project is to conduct a deep survey of faint continuum sources on a contiguous 4.8 arcmin by 4.8 arcmin = 23 arcmin^2 field (it consists of 9 tiles; each tile has a size of 1.6 arcmin by 1.6 arcmin). Further, in order to maximize the possibility for serendipitous detection of emission line galaxies, we have 2 frequency tunings. Therefore there are 9 tiles X 2 tunings = 18 science goals in this proposal.
*** continuum sensitivity ***
Our goal is to uncover >300 uJy sources with >5 sigma.
We aim a continuum sensitivity of 60 uJy rms after adding whole data, i.e., combining both tuning-1 and tuning-2. Specifically, the continuum data of the Science Goal "Tune1-Center" will be combined with the Science Goal "Tune2-Center".
Therefore, we request a continuum sensitivity of 83.8 uJy in each tuning, ensuring 83.8/sqrt(2) = 60 uJy rms in total.
*** line sensitivity ***
The requested continuum sensitivity above corresponds to a spectral line sensitivity of 700 uJy for a velocity resolution dv = 120 km/s. We will search for galaxies with an emission line feature (either [CII] at z~6.0-6.7 or CO at z<2) detectable with this sensitivity.

The primary goal of this project is to conduct a deep survey of faint continuum sources on a contiguous 4.8 arcmin by 4.8 arcmin = 23 arcmin^2 field (it consists of 9 tiles; each tile has a size of 1.6 arcmin by 1.6 arcmin). Further, in order to maximize the possibility for serendipitous detection of emission line galaxies, we have 2 frequency tunings. Therefore there are 9 tiles X 2 tunings = 18 science goals in this proposal.
*** continuum sensitivity ***
Our goal is to uncover >300 uJy sources with >5 sigma.
We aim a continuum sensitivity of 60 uJy rms after adding whole data, i.e., combining both tuning-1 and tuning-2. Specifically, the continuum data of the Science Goal "Tune1-Center" will be combined with the Science Goal "Tune2-Center".
Therefore, we request a continuum sensitivity of 83.8 uJy in each tuning, ensuring 83.8/sqrt(2) = 60 uJy rms in total.
*** line sensitivity ***
The requested continuum sensitivity above corresponds to a spectral line sensitivity of 700 uJy for a velocity resolution dv = 120 km/s. We will search for galaxies with an emission line feature (either [CII] at z~6.0-6.7 or CO at z<2) detectable with this sensitivity.

In order to maximize the continuum sensitivity, we emply the TDM mode, giving an effective instantaneous frequency coverage of 7.5 GHz.
The spectral resolution of TDM is 31.2 MHz or ~35 km/s at 1.1mm, which is sufficient for any serendipitous [CII] and CO line detections from high-z galaxies. Considering typical velocity widths of high-z galaxies, i.e., 100 km/s - 500 km/s (FWHM), a velocity resolution of ~35 km/s is appropriate.

All targets are high redshift sources and the sizes are naturally expected to be small, i.e., less than a few arcsec. On the other hand, in order to avoid loosing sensitivity for slightly extended galaxies (i.e., relatively low-z galaxies with an extended disk), we prefer a moderate angular resolution, i.e., 0.8 arcsec.
Note that 1.0 arcsec to 0.5 arcsec resolutions can be acceptable for our science cases, although too much high resolution (less than 0.4 arcsec, for instance) may result in loosing a sensitivity for extended galaxies.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose deep 23 arcmin^2 imaging of GOODS-S to a depth of 0.06 mJy (1.1 mm, 1 sigma) thereby ensuring a uniform census of galaxies with SFR > 50 Mo/yr up to z~10. This panoramic deep survey will be sufficiently sensitive to locate and study, for the first time, over a hundred faint "sub-mJy sources" thought to dominate the extragalactic background. The proposed survey design follows the successful outcome of our earlier Cycle 1/2 surveys of SXDF (1.5 arcmin^2) and SSA22 (4.5 arcmin^2) to a depth of 0.055 - 0.066 mJy at 1.1 mm.
In conjunction with the deepest JVLA 5cm data (0.3 uJy, 38 arcmin^2) along with the richest dataset of WFC3/IR-selected galaxies, we will determine the nature of the sub-mJy population. Through the redshift distribution, stellar masses, clustering, and AGN properties of this newly-found population, we will complete our understanding of the dust-obscured history of the Universe.
Our proposed 23 arcmin^2 survey is the logical next step after the ongoing 4 arcmin^2 HUDF survey and will guide future wider area ALMA campaigns. Thus, the proposed survey will have strategic importance and enormous legacy value.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
